title: Drawing, "Design for a Centerpiece", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, violet color pencil, graphite on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp: in black ink at center right: 379
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: CENTRE DE TABLE; at lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/45; to right of elevation:AMETHYSTE; in graphite at lower right corner: 2; on lower rim of plan: X
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Circular flared centerpiece drawn in plan and elevation, the protruding lip decorated with cabachom amethysts sitting on circular discs indicated in violet color pencil. Rounded lid surmounted by a falred, cylindrical finial with two applied flaring bands mounted by a cabochon amethyst indicated in violet color pencil. Lower body decorated with two applied flared bands and raised on a circular foot. Underdrawing in graphite of centerpiece in golden section.
Puiforcat fabrication #: 379
